sanskrit_verse:
संतुष्टो भार्यया भर्ता भर्त्रा भार्या तथैव च ।
यस्मिन्नेव कुले नित्यं कल्याणं तत्र वै ध्रुवम् ॥ ३.६०॥
transliteration:
saṃtuṣṭo bhāryayā bhartā bhartṛā bhāryā tathaiva ca |
yasminneva kule nityaṃ kalyāṇaṃ tatra vai dhruvam || 3.60 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The husband finds fulfillment through the wife; the wife finds fulfillment through the husband. In whichever family this mutual alignment and completion exist perpetually, there alone is assured welfare.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority arises from mutual recognition of capacity
Capacity-based responsibility is shared and reciprocal
Restoration logic operates through harmonious alignment
Consciousness alignment manifests as mutual completion
executable_legal_axioms: IF (husband.fulfillment_status == 'aligned' AND wife.fulfillment_status == 'aligned') THEN household.welfare_stability = TRUE
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating familial disputes, the Supreme Court must assess not individual fault but the degree of mutual alignment and completion between spouses. Where such alignment is absent, judicial intervention shall activate restoration protocols rather than assign blame. The threshold of responsibility lies in restoring relational harmony, not in punitive separation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that causality in human relationships originates from conscious alignment. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals that sustained mutual fulfillment leads to unbroken welfare. Proportional responsibility is measured by contribution to relational coherence. The non-punitive reality rule confirms that suffering does not arise from misalignment when restoration is enacted.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Deploy mutual fulfillment assessment and recalibration tools
Establish daily dharmic alignment practices within household unit
Activate family wellness continuity protocol upon verified realignment
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is hereby restored through the principle of mutual completion. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness stands as the ultimate adjudicator.
